page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: ON OUR TRIP ROUND THE AREA WE PASSED THREE FARMS AND THERE SEEMED TO BE AN EQUAL NUMBER OF FIELDS OF ARABLE AND GRASS. THERE WAS ALSO A LOT OF ROUGH AND WASTE LAND. WE INTERVIEWED THE FARMER AT LOW LAITHES FARM AND HE TOLD US HIS FARM WAS JUST OVER 4OO ACRES IN SIZE BUT THAT HE WAS ACTUALLY FARMING 75O ACRES WITH LAND IN OTHER AREAS. IT IS MAINLY A MILK PRODUCING FARM FROM 2OO COWS WHICH WERE MILKED TWICE A DAY AND PRODUCING OVER 6OO GALLONS DAILY. HE HAD 3 COWMEN AND 3 TRACTOR DRIVERS. 28O ACRES WAS GRASS AND 12O ACRES WAS USED TO GROW CORN FOR CATTLE FEED. HE HAD 5 TRACTORS, A COMBINE HARVESTER AND ALL THE OTHER IMPLEMENTS SUCH AS PLOUGHS, CULTIVATORS, HARROWS AND DRILLS. HE ALSO KEPT 35OO BATTERY HENS WHICH PRODUCED 12O-13O DOZ. EGGS A DAY TO RETAIL TO HIS MILK CUSTOMERS.
